title: 113_s1268
content: SECTION 1. APPROVAL OF THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE REPUBLIC OF PALAU. Definitions: Agreement refers to the document signed by the United States and Palau on September 3, 2010. Compact of Free Association refers to the agreement between the US and Palau. Results of Compact Review: Title I of Public Law 99-658 is amended to include a section on the results of the compact review. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, signed on September 3, 2010, is approved with exceptions and conditions. If Palau withdraws over $5,000,000 from the trust fund in fiscal years 2011-2013, certain payments under the Agreement will be withheld until the trust fund is reimbursed. The Agreement with Palau will be withheld until reimbursement for withdrawals exceeding $5,000,000 in fiscal years 2011-2013. Funding for specific provisions will be transferred within 30 days of enactment, and appropriations are authorized for postal services to Palau, Marshall Islands, and Micronesia. The Agreement with Palau will be withheld until reimbursement for withdrawals exceeding $5,000,000 in fiscal years 2011-2013. Funding for specific provisions will be transferred within 30 days of enactment, and appropriations are authorized for postal services to Palau, Marshall Islands, and Micronesia. The fiscal years 2014 through 2024 will provide necessary sums to Federal entities under the Compact of Free Association. Section 3 of the Act of June 30, 1954 is repealed, and the payment schedule and withholding of funds will be governed by Compact section 211(f) fund. The Compact Section 211(f) Fund governs the payment schedule and withholding of funds for Federal entities under the Compact of Free Association. The Government of the United States will contribute $30,250,000 to the Fund in accordance with a specified schedule. Additionally, a grant of $6,912,000 for fiscal year 2014 and $2,000,000 annually from 2015 to 2024 will be provided for the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund. The Republic of Palau will match the contributions made by the United States. The Republic of Palau will match the United States' contributions by providing $150,000 quarterly to the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund from 2014 to 2024. The implementation will follow the provisions of the Agreement. The Republic of Palau will match the United States' contributions by providing $150,000 quarterly to the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund from 2014 to 2024. The implementation will follow the provisions of the Agreement. SEC. 3. FISCAL CONSOLIDATION FUND. The United States will provide Palau with $10,000,000 in fiscal year 2014 to reduce government arrears. Additionally, the US will give Palau $69,250,000 in economic assistance over several fiscal years as outlined in the Agreement. In fiscal years 2017 to 2023, Palau will receive decreasing amounts of economic assistance from the United States, starting at $8,500,000 and decreasing to $2,000,000. The funds will be provided in quarterly payments unless specified otherwise. Additionally, infrastructure projects will be addressed in the Agreement. The United States will provide $40,000,000 in grants to Palau for infrastructure projects over several fiscal years. Additionally, there is an amendment to extend the Passport Requirement under the Compact of Free Association. Nonimmigrants in the United States and its territories can be admitted without certain passport requirements if they fall into specific categories, including citizens of the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands who are now citizens of Palau, those who acquire Palau citizenship at birth, and naturalized citizens who have been residents for at least five years. Citizens of Palau who have been residents for at least five years are permitted to accept employment in the United States and establish habitual residence in a territory or possession, subject to non-discriminatory limitations. However, they do not have the right to establish residence for naturalization under the Immigration and Nationality Act or petition for benefits for alien relatives under that Act.
